name: Volcano Lodge & Springs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights @ the Volcano Lodge and I must say, the workers are very nice and professional. We stayed in the 300 series rooms which is about a 5-7 minute walk from the lobby but you can ask the front desk to send the golf cart to pick you up if you don't like walking.
reviews.title: Very Nice, Top Notch Service, Clean!!

likes.liked: — Clean, Staff VERY knowledgeable and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very clean and safe. They have a safe in each room to store passports, money, valuables etc. There's also a porch in the back where you can relax after a long day of tours. We didn't get to see the Volcano cause it was cloudy pretty much all the days we were there.
reviews.title: Great Views, Value and Service

likes.liked: — Value - greate rooms for the price!

reviews.text: There are 2 restaurants at this hotel, one in the front (by the lobby) and one in the back (by the swim up pool). We had lunch at both and I liked the one in front the best.
reviews.title: Nice Stay, Great Value, Relaxing Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definetely stay at the Volcano Lodge again!!
reviews.title: A lack of class ruined my perception of the place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Volcano Lodge and was very happy with my decision to do so. I was impressed with how clean the grounds and rooms were. The staff was excellent and helpful. The rooms were nice and the best part was the patio outside. Great view of the Arenal Volcano! The pool was relaxing and I plan on coming back here with my children. Volcano Lodge and the Arenal area are perfect for a family vacation.
reviews.title: Nice for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was as close to the bottom of the volcano as you can get. The rooms were nice, my only complaint wa when it rains, which it did everyday, with the tin roof it was loud. The breakfast was ok, same thing everyday. Look at my profile, I haven't been to as many places as others, but I have been all over the US, Mexico, Central America, and Caribean; I have never been to a place where the staff, and locals were nicer. I couldn't believe how nice they were. Before you go to Arenal, find out which way the lava is flowing, it changes throughout the year. So make sure you stay at a hotel that is on the right side.
reviews.title: Great place, better view

likes.disliked: — Not on the side of lava flow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was awesome! the best hotel on our trip. Great price, Good breakfast, huge comfortable bed, big bathroom, very quiet. Well I should say very quiet until 4 am when Carlos, the golden retriever from the cattle ranch next door started barking. We talked to Carlos about his barking and he settled in to guard our back door and was quiet for about 10 minutes. I called the front desk and asked them come get the dog. They said, "oh that's Carlos" and laughed. They never came and my husband ended up walking Carlos to the front desk.
reviews.title: Best hotel of the Trip! Even with carlos!

likes.liked: — big room, nice folks, perfect view of the volcano

reviews.title: Loved It!
reviews.text: Probably not a reason to book somewhere else, just a funny story about the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't see any activity from the volcano but there is a perfect view from the back porch.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised~Well maintained

likes.liked: — Pleasant grounds, sizeable rooms, and overall how peaceful it was

reviews.title: Best view of volcano
reviews.text: Stayed at the Volcano Lodge for three nights in mid-November. Unfortunately the weather was spotty (rainy, foggy) but expected still for that time of year.

We stayed at the Volcano Lodge for 2 nights. Overall, the hotel was clean and had lovely grounds. The included buffet breakfast was plentiful with fresh fruit, juice, assorted breads and meats and a made-to-order omelet station (don't forget your breakfast tickets when you go!). The view of the volcano from our verandah was breathtaking. The location is good for getting to different areas of LaFortuna -- just a short taxi ride. There was a computer available for Internet access in the front lobby which was useful. Wireless is also available in the lobby free of charge. The room was very clean and the maid made towel animals which our kids liked.
reviews.title: Great value, location and view!
comfortable, clean and good services
reviews.text: We ate at both restaurants while we were there and the food was very tasty and also a good value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative aspect in our stay was that the front desk staff were not very friendly or helpful. It seemed like asking questions of them was a nuisance rather than their job. Also, when we arrived, our luggage was put into a van and we were driven to our room which was literally about 20 steps away from the lobby (6 rooms away). Can you spell T-I-P?
reviews.title: Great Hotel for Value and View!

likes.disliked: — It felt a little too resorty for our taste

reviews.text: We would stay here again if we were ever to visit LaFortuna again.
reviews.title: Clean room with a great view

reviews.text: Our family of 4 stayed at the volcano lodge and really enjoyed it. The cabins are spacious, clean and all have good views and pretty grounds. We'd stay here again.
reviews.title: What a gem!

likes.disliked: — too big property. Front desk and spa was very far from our room.

reviews.title: Will Always Remember This Place
reviews.text: My husband and I, along with our two boys ages 8 and 13, all loved the volcano lodge! We are a well traveled family and have stayed at many hotels in beautiful locations over the years but this one will be hard to beat. First of all, Arenal is a very cool place for adventure. Zip lines, ATV riding, Canyoning, Hiking and all with that awesome volcano in sight everywhere you go! This place was beautiful. The hotel grounds were gorgeous. There are flowers, butterflies and the greenest green foliage you will ever see. It was super clean and the staff was very friendly. I don't have a single complaint about the volcano Lodge. We are super picky and not impressed easily. Stay at this hotel. You won't be sorry!!!!

My husband, 2 teenagers and I stayed here the end of May. The location, views of the volcano, grounds, and staff were all great. It was only a $5 cab ride into La Fortuna. This is a convenient location for the ziplining, rapelling, and hikes we did. We stayed here 2 nights and at a high end property 2 nights. In hindsight, I would have stayed here all 4 nights. The rates are great for what you get. The rooms are nothing special, but we were in them so little, it wasn't an issue for us.
reviews.title: Great Value and Awesome View of Volcano

likes.liked: — Value, view of the volcano and location

reviews.text: This was one of our favorite hotels in Costa Rica. We were three young girls traveling alone. We always felt safe, the rooms were clean, the service was excellent and the food was good and fairly inexpensive. The hotel is very nice for the price and the property and view of the volcano are beautiful.
reviews.title: One of our favorite hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from 2 nights at the Volcano lodge. We were pleasantly surprised at how nice this place was considering the price we paid. Our room was large, comfortable and what we especially liked was that the rooms are maybe 4 to each building and spread apart, so you can open your window shades completely have a perfect view of the volcano without having to worry about people passing by,. You have privacy! You can even see the volcano from the shower!!
reviews.title: Great Value!

likes.disliked: — Hot tub needs to be a little hotter.

reviews.text: The pool/jacuzzi area is nice. The staff friendly and efficient. No problems here, we had a wonderful stay!
reviews.title: LOVED it!

description: At VOLCANO LODGE AND SPRINGS, located in La Palma, La Fortuna de San Carlos, at the foot of the majestic Arenal Volcano, our hot springs and lush tropical garden gives you joy and relaxation to our guests and companions. Undoubtedly, our location allows you to witness the imposing Arenal Volcano from a vantage point. QUALITY SERVICE: Knowing that service is the main reason of hospitality, the Volcano Lodge & Gardens’ team, will do our best to make your stay a very fond memory to take home. FACILITIES: All our 66 rooms are Superior and non smoking, have deluxe finishes, 2 comfortable full size beds or 1 king size bed, TV/cable, telephone, air-conditioned, coffee maker, hot water shower, hairdryer and a nice terrace facing the Volcano. We also offer 4 rooms for handicap. RESTAURANT:Sura Restaurant, capacity: 120 people, we’ll be offering you our traditional local and international food, while you enjoy the majestic view of the volcano, birds surrounded nature. You can ask for room service too. OTHER FACILITIES: *Two swimming pools for adults, two swimming pools for children and two Jacuzzis, all of them with view to the Volcano.*Laundry service, Private parking, Internet Access / Wireless Free, Tours information, nature trail, Playground.* Massages Service from 9 am to 9 pm.
